snippet: After 15 months of speculation, investigators appear to be tying up loose ends in the inquiry into gridlock on the New Jersey side of the bridge, a scandal that ensnared Gov. Chris Christie.
abstract: Series of interviews with members of the Borough Council in Fort Lee, NJ, indicate federal investigators are nearing end of inquiry into September 2013 lane closings at George Washington Bridge, with indictments expected to follow; subpoenas so far show that inquiry has expanded past lane closures to include possible conflicts of interest and bribery, but significant questions remain, including case's implications for New Jersey Gov Chris Christie.
lead_paragraph: After 15 months of speculation, investigators appear to be tying up loose ends in the inquiry into gridlock on the New Jersey side of the bridge, a scandal that ensnared Gov. Chris Christie.

headline.main: Indictments May Be Near in George Washington Bridge Scandal
headline.print_headline: Indictments May Be Near in U.S. Inquiry on Closing of Bridge’s Access Lanes

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
